L <- function(theta) {
  # Data vector (will be provided in the actual function call)
  x <- c(0.2, 0.5, 0.3, 0.2)  # Using the sample provided in part b
  
  # Number of observations
  n <- length(x)
  
  # Computing the likelihood
  likelihood <- theta^n * prod(x^(theta-1))
  
  return(likelihood)
}
